result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessy Allan Kujac was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.  Credit listed below is not duplicate to 13CF655
Consecutive to: to 13CF655

STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.
Consecutive to: to 13CF655

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with assessments, treatment, counseling and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessy Allan Kujac

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
13CF655 & 14CF1116
Defendant Jessy Allan Kujac in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No additions / corrections to either PSI.  State recommendation:  follow PSI rec.  Defendant makes statement.
 
BTC:
13CF655:  battery - 3 years WPS > 18 months initial confinement / 18 months extended supervision, I/S for 3 years, 3 years probation; conditional time equates to time served
DNA costs & surcharges

14CF1116:  bail jumping - 2 years WPS > 12 months initial confinement / 12 months extended supervision, I/S, 3 years probation.
DNA surcharges
concurrent on probation, consecutive to 13CF655 if revoked

Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician,to be monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts.  AODA & follow through.  
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent & follow through with recommendations.
Seek/obtain/maintain full-time employment or employment / school to equal full time.
No contact with co-actors.
FAW / vote / jury service
Bad Time Rules to be attached to JOC.
CIP:  yes
ERP:  yes
costs / fine + CC

Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell. Defendant Jessy Allan Kujac in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for Robert Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  13CF655 set for sentencing.  Charged in  14CF1116.  State's offer to follow PSI.  PSI doesn't make recommendation for the new charges, but they are aware of the charges.  Need updated PSI & proceed to sentencing at a later date.  Waiver form received by the court.  Elements attached to Waiver.  Colloquy with defendent.  
Guilty plea entered in 14CF1116.  
BTC:  Guilty finding made.  SEH on 13CF655 & 14CF1116 set. Updated PSI ordered.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Jessy Allan Kujac in court with attorney Helmi Hamad for Atty Carl Johnson.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jessy Allan Kujac in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Jessy Allan Kujac in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
